title: PytagoraZ
author: PytagoraZ
content: 17 August 2023 is the independence day of the Republic of Indonesia. In our country, in order to welcome independence day, we usually carry out various activities to celebrate independence activities. Such as competitions, carnivals, thanksgiving, and others.I see a lot of activities supported by merit source so that many members are enthusiastic to take part. I request support from merit source in this activity created in thread: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5463180.0You can monitor this thread to see photos of activities and festivities commemorating the independence of the Republic of Indonesia or in our regional language it is often called "tujuhbelasan" ('tujuhbelasan' is the term for the number 17 in the local language)If there is a merit source willing to support, I would be grateful

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: No activities relate to Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies so that merit sources actually have reasons to support if support means distributing merit in that thread.By the way, congratulate for your national Indonesian Independence Day.

comments.author: PytagoraZ
comments.body: Quote from: dzungmobile on August 14, 2023, 01:34:35 AMNo activities relate to Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies so that merit sources actually have reasons to support if support means distributing merit in that thread.By the way, congratulate for your national Indonesian Independence Day.Yes you're right. This is an activity on a local scale in our country. But I think it can increase member participation if there is support from merit sources.Am I not allowed to ask for support from merit sources for such activities? sorry I don't know about that

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: dzungmobile on August 14, 2023, 01:34:35 AMNo activities relate to Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies so that merit sources actually have reasons to support if support means distributing merit in that thread.Those aren't prerequisites for merit sources handing out merits, just so you know.  I'd be happy to merit posts in that thread provided they were good and they were in English (which they're not).  I'm not sure why OP is making an appeal for help to merit sources anyway--it seems kind of odd to me, especially since there haven't been that many posts made in his linked thread so far.Quote from: PytagoraZ on August 14, 2023, 01:51:53 AMAm I not allowed to ask for support from merit sources for such activities? sorry I don't know about thatThere's no rule against it that I know of; I just think it's odd personally, not that it's against forum rules or even that it's shady.  Does the Indonesian section not have at least one merit source?

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on August 14, 2023, 01:58:05 AMDoes the Indonesian section not have at least one merit source?Nope, I think there are few merit sources there because they have two moderators which mean the section must be active. Looking at the total post and merit flooding in their local board there's no need to seek such help because they're top 2 position in the highest merit sharing. The @OP is greedy, he want more merit especially in his thread. Maybe he want to create a shitty merit festival like pizza contest where people just posting a picture about something rounded with BTC letter and get a lot merit.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: If you can get genuine people to participate in your thread I’m sure you might get one or two merit sources im your thread but for now there’s no activity there and now that you have created this thread appealing that a merit source visit the thread and merit future posts (which sounds odd to me) the only thing you’ll get in your thread now are users trying to milk merits not those that are participating genuinely.I believe that your local board have some merit source, if the activity in your thread increases they would have helped you out with the merits that you’re currently appealing for. Happy Independence Day celebration, btw.
